result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:33 AM - 19 CT 79, 19 CT 81, 20 CM 15, 20 CM 75, 22 CM 25 - Defendant Jennifer Richelle Monty in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer in court for Jennifer Richelle Monty.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 19 CT 79 & 19 CT 81 - Plea N/C in each case/ct, ct accepts plea & finds def G.  St recommend $100/fine + csts, DNA in each case.  Atty req $10/fine.  SENT:  $10/fine + csts, DNA w/in 7 days.  CASH that is pst'd remains pst'd as covers numerous.  PP of $20/mo begin 10/1/2022.  Ct will schedule 1 day JT on 12/1 @ 8 am as #1 - stacks all 3 on same dte/time for JT in following order 20 CM 75, 22 CM 25, 20 CM 15.  Final STC 11/14 @ 2 pm & DAP.  Ct prepare schedule order.
Plea hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Notice Regarding Posting Bond

Notice Regarding Posting Bond

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
  Def to have NO Contact w/ C.G.
